title: The Hazards of Sitting: An Osteopathâ€™s Approach to Preventing Work-Related Injury.

speakers.name: Michele Parsley-Lanning D.O.
speakers.bio:
After completing both a Java Full Stack Web Development and Data Analytics Bootcamp through Tech Talent South in 2019, I accepted a full-time position at CAS (Chemical Abstracts Service). 
 
 Prior to working with CAS, I was an Internal Medicine Physician but I decided to make a change career to technology. I hold a degree in Osteopathic Medicine (DO)  from Ohio University Heritage College of Osteopathic Medicine and a BA Biology with a Biomedical Science Concentration with a Chemistry Minor.
 
 In my spare time, I enjoy spending time with my husband, Wes and our two parrots: Willie and Bob as well as bird watching, hiking, baking, volunteering and hockey. Let's go CBJ!

description:
My training as an Osteopathic Physician prepared me to counsel my patients about  injury and disease prevention. However, I did not realize the full impact of spending a majority of my time sitting at a desk would have on my overall movement and flexibility.

In this talk, I will provide background education on the most common injuries software engineers are at risk to develop and how I try to prevent these by implementing a few simple measures daily at work.

Some of the measures include proper chair/desk/monitor adjustment, workspace setup, stretching routine that can be easily implemented at your desk and much more.
